intro: Finlaysonia insularum, commonly known as the island finlaysonia, is a rare flowering plant native to the Galápagos Islands. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its hairy stems and showy, pinkish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to the unique climate of the islands. It has small, elliptical leaves and produces capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
